personas.persona_name: US Enterprise B2B SaaS - Revenue Leaders
personas.company_type: Large enterprise SaaS vendors and platform companies with global go-to-market teams, complex billing/recurring revenue models, and centralized procurement
personas.description: Large US enterprise B2B SaaS companies with global GTM and centralized finance teams. 50-200 sales reps. $500K-$2M annual contracts with 6-12 month sales cycles involving 6-9 stakeholders. Procurement typically requires security, finance, legal and engineering sign-off and favors executive sponsorship and pilot evaluations. Strong fit for Stripe Payments, Billing, Tax and Radar; best engaged via executive briefings, technical workshops, pilot programs and enterprise case studies.

personas.company_type: Mid-market European marketplaces and platform businesses facilitating multi-party transactions that need onboarding, payouts, compliance and embedded finance
personas.description: Mid-market online marketplaces in Europe managing multi-party flows, KYC, payouts and platform economics. 20-100 platform and operations staff. $100K-$350K annual spend with 3-6 month sales cycles involving 3-5 decision makers. Decisions center on integration effort, compliance (KYC/AML), margin impact and time-to-market. Best engaged through technical integration docs, compliance case studies, sandboxed Connect + Treasury proofs and partner success stories.

personas.persona_name: APAC Large Retail & E-commerce - Commerce Leaders
personas.company_type: Large omnichannel retailers and e-commerce chains in APAC modernizing checkout, in-store payments, loyalty and tax compliance across multiple countries
personas.description: Large APAC retailers and omnichannel e-commerce chains focused on modernizing checkout, in‑store payments and loyalty. 50-200 commerce, payments and store operations staff. $200K-$800K annual contracts with 4-8 month procurement cycles involving 4-6 stakeholders. Buying decisions include CDO/CMO, head of stores, finance and procurement with emphasis on local payment methods, POS hardware and tax/regulatory compliance. Best engaged via localized references, POS pilot programs, integrated tax/terminal demos and proofs of authorization/conversion uplift.

result.generation_reasoning: Three personas were selected to cover Stripe's strongest addressable markets: enterprise B2B SaaS (high-value, complex billing and revenue operations), mid-market European online marketplaces (platforms needing Connect/Treasury/Identity), and large APAC retail & e-commerce (omnichannel commerce, Terminal, Checkout, Tax). CRM data was not provided, so personas were generated from Stripe's public web content (product pages, changelog, newsroom) and industry best practices. Web content influenced location choices (Stripe's global footprint and explicit EU/APAC expansion informed geographic focus), industry selections (product-market fit: Billing/Payments → B2B SaaS; Connect/Treasury → Marketplaces; Terminal/Checkout/Tax → Retail & E-commerce), company_size_range (enterprise signals and customer logos guided larger ranges for SaaS and retail; marketplace scale indicated mid-market ranges), and job_titles (buyer functions mapped to product docs and typical procurement stakeholders: revenue/ops for SaaS, platform/finance/compliance for marketplaces, commerce/marketing/ops for retail). Job title lists follow the master patterns for seniority and include variations to maximize match coverage.

data_sources.crm_data_influence: CRM data not available or not used
